instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB data on right side
threads.message:
I get a light on USB device on this side but no data. Left side is fine. 

Board appears clean other than very minor corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C7336</CAPACITOR> and some gunk in left side USB (removed). 
Replaced i/o board and both cables with known good. 
Same function in boot menu/OS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no USB data on right side
threads.message:
Inspect RIO connector (J9500) on MLB.
Check diode mode to ground on data lines.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C9501</CAPACITOR>/2 are good.

Both USB 2/3.0 not working?
